titleStmt.title: on the Parliament house by Dr Swift

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: As I strolle the City oft I
See a building large & lofty
not a Bowshot from the Colledge
half the Globe from Sence & knowledge
by the prudent Architect
placed against the Church direct
making good my Grannums jest
nearer the Church·..... You know the rest.
Tell me what this Pile contains
many a head that holds no brains
the Demoniacks lett one dub
With the name of Legion Club
Such Assemblies you might Swear
meet when Butchers bait a Bear
such a noise & such haranguing
when a Brother theif's a hanging
such a rout & such a rabble
run to hear Iack pudding babble
Such a Croud the Ordure throws
on a far less Villains nose
could I from the building top
hear the rattling thunder drop
While the Devil from the Roof
if the Devil be thunder proof
Should with Poker fiery red
Crack the Stones & melt the Lead
drive them down on every scull
when the Den of thieves is full
quite destroy the hornets nest
how might then the Isle be blest
for Divines allow that God
Sometimes makes the Devil his rod
and the Gospel will informe us
He can punish Crimes enormous
Yet should Swift endow his Schools
for his Lunaticks & Fools
with a Rood or two of Land
I allow the pile might stand
You perhaps will ask me why so
but it is with this Proviso
Since the house is like to last
let a Royal Grant be past
that the Club have leave to dwell
Each within his proper Cell
with a passage left to creep in
and a hole above for peeping
Let them when they once get in
Sell the Nation for a pin
while they sitt a picking Straws
Let them rave of making Laws
while they never hold their tongue
let them dabble in their dung
Let them forme a grand Committee
how to plague and Starve the Citty
Let them starve, Storm & frown
When they see a Clergy Gown
Let them e're they crack a Louse
Call for th'Orders of the House
Let them with their gosling quills
Scribble senseless heads of Bills
We may while they strain their throats
Wipe our A....s with their Votes
Let Sir Thom that rampant Ass
Stuff his Guts with flesh and grass
but before the preist he fleeces
tear the Bible all in pieces
at the Parson Tom hallow boy
Worthy offspring of a Shoeboy.
Footman Traitor Vile Seducer
perjur'd Rebell, bribed accuser
Lay thy paultry Privilege aside
Sprung from a papist & a Regicide

Fall a working like a Mole raise the dirt about thy holeLet us try some new Expedientcome assist my Muse obedientShift the Scene for half an hourtime & place are in thy powerthither gentle Muse conduct meI shall ask & You instruct me.
See the Muse unbarns the Gate
hark the Monkeys how they prate
all the Gods who rule the Soul
Styx thro' Hell whose Waters rowl
lett me be allowed to tell
what I hear in Yonder Cell
near the Door an Entrance gapes
Crouded round with antick shapes
Poverty & Grief & Care
Laweless joy & true Despair
Discord perriwigg'd with Snakes
See the dreadfull Strides she takes
by the Odious Crew besett
I begun to rage & frett
And resolved to break their pates
e're we entred at the Gates
had not Clio in the Nick
Whisper'd me, let fall Your Stick
What, said I, is this the Madhouse?
these, she answer'd, are but Shaddows
Phantoms bodyless and vain
empty visions of the Plain
in the porch Briaieus stands
Shews a bribe in all his hands
Briaieus the Secretary
but the Mortals call him Cary
when the Rogues their Country fleece
they may hope for pence a piece
Clio who hath been so wise
to put on a Fools disguise
to respect some approbation
& be thought a near Relation
When the twenty hundred Brutes
all involved in wild disputes
roaring till their Lungs were spent
Privilege of Parliament
now a new Misfortune feels
dreading to be laid by th' heels
never durst a Muse before
Enter that infernal Door
Clio Stiffled with the smell
into Spleen & Vapours fell
by the Stygian Steems that flew
from the dire infectious Crew
not the Stench of Lake Avernus
could have more offended her nose
had she flown but or'e the top
She must feel her pinion drop
and by exhalations dire
tho' a Goddess must expire
in a fright she crept away
bravely I resolved to stay
when I saw the Keeper frown
tipping him with half a Crown
Now said I we're here alone
name Your Heroes one by one
Who is that hell featured Bawler
is it Satan? No, 'tis Waller
in what figure can a Bardress
Jack the Grandson of Sir Hardress
honest keeper drive him further
in his looks are Hell and Murther
See his Scowling Visage drop
just as when he murther'd Throp
Keeper shew me where to fix
on the Puppy pair of Dicks
by their lanthorn jaws & Leathern,
You may swear they both are Brethern
Dick ······· Baker Dick the player
old acquaintance are You there
Dear Companion hugg & kiss
tost old glorious in Your piss
tye them Keeper in a tether
let them Share & Stink together
both are apt to be unruly
lash them daily lash them duly
tho' 'tis hopeless to reclaim them
Scorpion Rods perhaps may tame them
Keeper yon old Dotard Smoke
Sweetly Snoring in his Cloake
Who is he? 'tis hum drum Wynne
half encompass'd with his Kin
there observe the Tribe of Bingham
for he never fails to bring them
for the base Aposte Vesey
with Bishops scraps tho' fat & greasy
while he sleeps the whole Debate
they Submissive round him Waite
Yet would gladly see the Hunks
in his grave & search his Trunks
See they gently pull his Coate
just to yawn & give his Vote
These are Allens Iack and Bob
first in every wicked Iob
Son & Brother to a queer
brainsick Brute they call a Peer
we must give them better quarter
for their Ancestors trod Mortar
and at Sloth to boast his fame
on a Chimney cut his name
there sitt Clements Dilks & Carter
who for Hell would die a Martyr
such a triplet could You tell
where to find on this side Hell
Gallows Carter Dilks and Clements
Souse them in their own Excrements
evry mischief in their hearts
if they fail 'tis want of parts
bless Morgan art thou there man
bless my Eyes art thou the Chairman
Chairman to Yon damned Committee
Yet I look on thee with pity
dreadfull Sight what learned Morgan
Metamorphosed to a Gorgon
for thy horrid looks I own
half Convert me to a Stone
hast thou been so long at School
now to turn a factious fool
alma Mater was thy Mother
evry Young Divine thy Brother
thou a disobedient Varlet
treat thy Mother like an Harlot
thou ungratefull to thy Teachers
Who are all grown rev'rend preachers
Morgan would it not Surprize one
turn thy nourishment to poison
When You walk among Your books
they reproach insyou with their looks
bind them fast or from their Shelves
they'll fly down to right themselves.
Homer Plutarch Virgil Flaccus
all in arms prepare to Bacchus
Soon repent or put to slaughter
Evry Greek and Roman Author
Will You in Your factions phrase
Send the Clergy all to graze
And to make Your project pass
leave them not one blade of grass
Now I want the humorous Hogarth
thou correctingan I hear a correctingthe pleasant rogue art correctingact
were but You & I acquainted
evry Monster should be painted
You should try the graving tools
on this odious group of fools
Draw the Beasts as I describe them
from their features while I guide them
draw them like for I assure You
it will need no Caracatura
draw them too that we may trace
all the Soul in evry face
Keeper I must now retire
You have done what I desire
but I find my Spirits Spent
with the Noise & Sight & Scent
Pray be patient You shall find
half the best are still behind
You have hardly seen a Score
I can show two hundred more
Keeper I have seen enough
taking then a pinch of Snuff
I concluded looking round them
May their God, the Devil, confound 'em.829-135Y
